question: What is the Highest Mountain in Africa?
hints: It is a dormant volcano, with three Volcanic cones, "Kibo", "Mawenzi", and "Shira"
aboutAnswer:
Mount Kilimanjaro with its three volcanic cones, "Kibo", "Mawenzi", and "Shira", is a dormant volcano in Tanzania. It is the highest mountain in Africa, with 5,895 metres (19,341 ft) of height above sea level.
The first people known to have reached the summit of the mountain were Hans Meyer and Ludwig Purtscheller, in 1889. The mountain is part of Kilimanjaro National Park and is a major climbing destination.
The mountain has been the subject of many scientific studies because of its shrinking glaciers and disappearing ice fields.
